title: Bartender
description:
We are seeking enthusiastic, experienced bartenders to join our team at a high-trafficked, well known neighborhood spot on the Upper East Side. Looking for bartenders who have fine dining quality service skills with an approachable, genuine, kind personality suited for our casual & cozy restaurant and team.

We expect our team to achieve a masterful comprehension of our menus and food and beverage offerings. We encourage our team to find personal, meaningful relationships to our food & beverages, and share that personal connection and excitement with our guests and each other.

Previous NYC hospitality experience required. Candidates with a generosity of spirit, committed work ethic and attention to detail are strongly encouraged to apply!

**Responsibilities**

* Interact with customers, take orders and curate unforgettable guest experiences.
* Master knowledge of food & beverage menus.
* Build relationships with regulars and first time guests, as well as build relationships with potential personal new regulars.
* Assess customers’ needs and preferences and make recommendations
* Work well with team to execute open & close duties
* Stay guest focused and nurture an excellent guest experience
* Comply with all food and beverage regulations

**Skills**

* At least 1 year NYC bartending experience; Significant hospitality experience
* Excellent knowledge of specialty cocktails, wine, & beer
* Proficient with classic cocktails & bar operations and standards
* Lightspeed POS experience a plus
* Positive attitude and excellent communication skills
* Ability to keep bar organized, stocked and clean
* Relevant training

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $15.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid training

Shift:

* Day shift
* Night shift

Work Location: In person

title: Director
description:
Job Title: Director of Day Care

Location: East Islip, New York

**Overview:**

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Director to lead our licensed daycare center located in East Islip, New York. The Director will be responsible for the overall management and operations of the daycare facility, ensuring a safe, nurturing, and educational environment for the children in our care. This is an exciting opportunity for an individual passionate about early childhood education and dedicated to the well-being of young children.

We need a self-starter, who can assist in growing a previously 30-year-old daycare under new management. The newly renovated daycare has a license to care for about 100 children from infants to school going age and the Director will be responsible for growing the enrollment count.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. Oversee the day-to-day operations of the daycare center, including staff management, curriculum development, and facility maintenance.

2. Ensure compliance with all state regulations and licensing requirements governing daycare facilities.

3. Develop and implement age-appropriate educational programs and activities that promote the physical, emotional, and cognitive development of children.

4. Recruit, hire, train, and evaluate staff members to maintain a high-quality team of caregivers and educators.

5. Foster positive relationships with parents and families, providing regular communication and support.

6. Manage the budget and financial aspects of the daycare center, including tuition fees, expenses, and payroll.

7. Collaborate with community organizations, schools, and other stakeholders to enhance the services and resources available to children and families.

**Qualifications:**

1. Bachelor's degree in Early Childhood Education, Child Development, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.

2. Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a leadership role within a daycare or early childhood education setting.

3. Knowledge of state regulations and licensing requirements for daycare centers in New York.

4. Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.

5. Ability to work effectively with children, families, and staff members from diverse backgrounds.

6. First Aid and CPR certification preferred.

**Benefits:**

- Competitive salary based on experience

- Health insurance and retirement benefits

- Professional development opportunities

- Paid time off and holidays

If you are a dedicated, compassionate, and experienced professional looking to make a positive impact on the lives of children and families in East Islip, New York, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding position as the Director of our daycare center.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* No weekends

Education:

* Master's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* First Aid Certification (Preferred)
* CPR Certification (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* East Islip, NY (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* East Islip, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
\\*Job Summary\\* We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Nurse to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing high-quality patient care, conducting assessments, and developing individualized care plans. This role requires strong clinical skills, effective communication, and the ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team to ensure optimal patient outcomes. \\*Responsibilities\\* - Conduct comprehensive patient assessments and develop nursing care plans based on individual needs. - Administer medications and treatments as prescribed by physicians. - Monitor patients' vital signs and report any changes in condition to the healthcare team. - Provide education and support to patients and their families regarding health management and treatment options. - Implement infection control measures to ensure patient safety. - Assist with acute pain management strategies for patients in need. - Participate in critical care transport when necessary, ensuring safe transfer of patients. - Perform physical examinations and document findings accurately. - Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to coordinate patient care effectively. - Maintain accurate medical records and documentation in compliance with regulatory standards. \\*Skills\\* - Proficient in acute pain management techniques and behavioral health assessments. - Knowledgeable in infection control protocols and critical care transport procedures. - Experience with sonography, mammography, and performing sutures is a plus. - Familiarity with workers' compensation law as it pertains to nursing practice. - Strong ability to lift patients safely while adhering to proper body mechanics. - Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with a focus on patient education. - Ability to work effectively under pressure in fast-paced environments while maintaining attention to detail. Join our team of healthcare professionals dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our patients through exceptional nursing care!

Job Type: Full-time

Expected hours: 40 – 45 per week

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

title: Personal/Household Assistant
description:
Seeking a **Personal/Household Assistant** to help manage daily household operations efficiently. Looking for someone highly organized, proactive, and tech-savvy, with strong skills in managing communications and household tasks. This position is live-out.

**Responsibilities:**

* General household organization, including managing household supplies and maintaining order.
* **Family laundry**, including washing, drying, and organizing clothes.
* Basic meal preparation (simple, straightforward meals).
* Running errands such as grocery shopping, mail, and car maintenance.
* Assisting with various household tasks such as returns, purchases, and overseeing home upkeep.
* Managing household manuals, documents, and records.
* Organizing travel arrangements, including research, booking, and planning.
* Tracking household expenses and managing financial reports.
* **Managing email communications**: maintaining an organized inbox, responding to emails promptly, and ensuring all correspondence is handled efficiently.
* Making and managing appointments for family members (doctors, dentists, etc.).

**Requirements:**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role.
* A valid driver’s license with a clean driving record (must have own vehicle - gas/mileage will be reimbursed).
* **Tech-savvy** with strong proficiency in email management tools and organization.
* Must be a self-starter with strong problem-solving skills.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
* **Exceptional organization** and communication skills, particularly in handling email correspondence.
* Must be reliable, structured, and detail-oriented.
* Experience with handling household operations and administrative tasks.

**Schedule:**

* Monday to Saturday, 4-5 hours per day.
* Some evening and weekend support may be required.

**Salary:**

* Depending on experience, $35-40/hour.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $35.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

title: Assistant Manager(03916)99 Route 23 South
description:
**Company Description**  

One of the largest Franchisee in the tristate area. A company where People are first. We love our team members, and we create an environment where you can provide for your family and grow in the company.

 **Job Description**  

  

**ABOUT THE JOB**
You were born to be the boss. We know. You get up in the morning and you make sure everyone else in the house is doing what they need to do. Then you go to work and you make sure that everyone there is doing what they need to do, even your boss. You just do that because you've always done it. Well maybe it's time you moved up. You want to be the boss? Well now's your chance - Domino's Pizza is hiring bosses - more specifically assistant managers. It's a tough job, one that needs a natural like you. Of course, you'll need some skills - judgment, math and the ability to multitask.


You'll be working for a company that's fun and flexible. Not to mention, it's work experience you're going to use for a long time to come. You've had our pizza delivered to you, now help us be the best in pizza delivery. Go on, boss, show us what you've got. Apply now!

**JOB REQUIREMENTS AND DUTIES**


You are responsible for everything that happens during your shift. This includes all cost controls, inventory control, cash control and Customer relations. You must set the example. You must follow ALL policy and procedures 100% of the time and expect the same from your crew.


In addition: Staffing, Paperwork, Cost Controls, Cash control, Food management, Work to a Schedule, Perfect Image and adherence to standards, Great Customer Service, Attendance & punctuality, Transportation to/from work, Store cleanliness, Marketing, Profitability.

**ADVANCEMENT**


Many of our team members began their careers as delivery drivers and today are successful Domino's franchise owners. From assistant manager to general manager, general manager to franchisee or Manager Corporate Operations, our stores offer a world of opportunity.

**DIVERSITY**


Our mission is to recognize, appreciate, value and utilize the unique talents and contributions of all individuals. To create an environment where all team members, because of their differences, can reach their highest potential.

**SUMMARY STATEMENT**


We take pride in our team members and our team members take pride in Domino's Pizza! Being the best pizza delivery company in the world requires exceptional team members working together. At Domino's Pizza, our people come first!

**General Job Duties For All Store Team Members**

* Operate all equipment.
* Stock ingredients from delivery area to storage, work area, walk-in cooler.
* Prepare product.
* Receive and process telephone orders.
* Take inventory and complete associated paperwork.
* Clean equipment and facility approximately daily.

**Training**


Orientation and training provided on the job.

**Communication Skills**

* Ability to comprehend and give correct written instructions.
* Ability to communicate verbally with customers and co-workers to process orders both over the phone and in person.

**Essential Functions/Skills**

* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide accurately and quickly (may use calculator).
* Must be able to make correct monetary change.
* Verbal, writing, and telephone skills to take and process orders. Motor coordination between eyes and hands/fingers to rapidly and accurately make precise movements with speed.
* Ability to enter orders using a computer keyboard or touch screen.
* Navigational skills to read a map, locate addresses within designated delivery area.
* Must navigate adverse terrain including multi-story buildings, private homes, and other delivery sites while carrying product.

**Work Conditions**

**EXPOSURE TO**

* Varying and sometimes adverse weather conditions when removing trash and performing other outside tasks.
* In-store temperatures range from 36 degrees in cooler to 90 degrees and above in some work areas.
* Sudden changes in temperature in work area and while outside.
* Fumes from food odors.
* Exposure to cornmeal dust.
* Cramped quarters including walk-in cooler.
* Hot surfaces/tools from oven up to 500 degrees or higher.
* Sharp edges and moving mechanical parts.
* Varying and sometimes adverse weather conditions when delivering product, driving and couponing.

**SENSING**

* Talking and hearing on telephone. Near and mid-range vision for most in-store tasks.
* Depth perception.
* Ability to differentiate between hot and cold surfaces.
* Far vision and night vision for driving.

**TEMPERAMENTS**


The ability to direct activities, perform repetitive tasks, work alone and with others, work under stress, meet strict quality control standards, deal with people, analyze and compile data, make judgments and decisions.

 **Additional Information**  

  

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**, including, but not limited to the following:**Standing**


Most tasks are performed from a standing position. Walking surfaces include ceramic tile "bricks" with linoleum in some food process areas. Height of work surfaces is between 36" and 48".

**Walking**

* For short distances for short durations
* Delivery personnel must travel between the store and delivery vehicle and from the delivery vehicle to the customer's location.

**Sitting**


Paperwork is normally completed in an office at a desk or table

**Lifting**

* Bulk product deliveries are made twice a week or more and are unloaded by the team member using a hand truck.
* Deliveries may include cases of ingredients and supplies weighing up to 50 pounds with dimensions of up to 3' x 1.5'.
* Cases are usually lifted from floor and stacked onto shelves up to 72" high.

**Carrying**

* Large cans, weighing 3 pounds, 7 ounces, are carried from the workstation to storage shelves.
* Occasionally, pizza sauce weighing 30 pounds is carried from the storage room to the front of the store.
* Trays of pizza dough are carried three at a time over short distances, and weigh approximately 12 pounds per tray.

* During delivery, carry pizzas and beverages while performing "walking" and "climbing" duties.

**Pushing**

* To move trays which are placed on dollies.
* A stack of trays on a dolly is approximately 24" - 30" and requires a force of up to 7.5 pounds to push.
* Trays may also be pulled.

**Climbing**

* Team members must infrequently navigate stairs or climb a ladder to change prices on signs, wash walls, perform maintenance.
* During delivery of product, navigation of five or more flights of stairs may be required.

**Stooping/Bending**

* Forward bending at the waist is necessary at the pizza assembly station.
* Toe room is present, but workers are unable to flex their knees while standing at this station.
* Duration of this position is approximately 30 - 45 seconds at one time, repeated continuously during the day.
* Forward bending is also present at the front counter and when stocking ingredients.

**Crouching/Squatting**


Performed occasionally to stock shelves and to clean low areas.

**Reaching**

* Reaching is performed continuously; up, down and forward.
* Workers reach above 72" occasionally to turn on/off oven controls, change prices on sign, and lift and lower objects to and from shelves.
* Workers reaching down to perform such tasks as scooping cornmeal from a plastic barrel, or washing dishes.
* Workers reach forward when obtaining topping ingredients, cleaning work surfaces, or answering phones.

**Driving**

* Deliver pizzas within a designated delivery area. A Team Member may make several deliveries per shift.

**Hand Tasks**

* Eye-hand coordination is essential. Use of hands is continuous during the day.
* Frequently activities require use of one or both hands. Shaping pizza dough requires frequent and forceful use of forearms and wrists.
* Workers must manipulate a pizza peel when removing pizza from the oven, and when using the rolling cutter.
* Frequent and/or forceful pinching is required in the assembly of cardboard pizza boxes.
* Team Members must be able to grasp cans, the phone, the pizza cutter and pizza peel, and pizza boxes.

**Machines, Tools, Equipment, Work Aids**


Team Members may be required to utilize pencils/pens, computers, telephones, calculators, TDD equipment, pizza cutter and pizza peel.

**Driving Specific Job Duties**

* Deliver product by car and then to door of customer.
* Deliver flyers and door hangers.

**Requires**

* Valid driver's license with safe driving record meeting company standards.
* Access to insured vehicle which can be used for delivery.

title: Used Car Director
description:
Route 23 Nissan & Group is seeking to hire a seasoned and qualified Used Car Director. with a track record of integrity, stability and proven success.

About Us: We are a group of 3 dealerships and growing. We are very used car oriented and are looking for a top talent candidate to maintain and grow the used car departments inventory, efficiency and profitability

\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\*

We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Used Car Director/ Group Buyer to lead our pre-owned vehicle department. As the Used Car Director, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our used car operations, including purchasing, pricing, sales, and inventory management. You will play a crucial role in driving sales growth, maximizing profitability, and ensuring exceptional customer satisfaction.

\\*\\*Responsibilities:\\*\\*

- Develop and implement strategic plans to drive sales growth and increase market share in the pre-owned vehicle market.

- Manage all aspects of the used car department, including inventory acquisition, pricing, merchandising, and reconditioning.

- Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences to identify opportunities for business expansion and improvement.

- Recruit, train, and mentor sales staff to ensure high levels of performance, professionalism, and customer service.

- Collaborate with other departments, such as finance and marketing, to develop effective sales promotions, advertising campaigns, and pricing strategies.

- Establish and maintain relationships with wholesalers, auctions, and other suppliers to ensure a steady supply of high-quality used vehicles.

- Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), such as inventory turnover, gross profit margin, and sales conversion rates, and take corrective actions as needed.

- Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and company policies related to the sale and financing of used vehicles.

- Continuously evaluate and improve processes, systems, and technologies to streamline operations and enhance efficiency.

\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\*

- Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field (preferred but not required).

- Minimum of 7 years of experience in automotive used car management, with at least 2 years in a director and management or leadership role.

- Proven track record of success in driving sales growth and maximizing profitability in the used car market.

- Strong understanding of automotive financing, leasing, and insurance products.- Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.

-**EXCELLENT VERIFIABLE REFERENCES IS A MUST!**

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and dealership management software.

- Valid driver's license with a clean driving record.

\\*\\*Benefits:\\*\\*

Health, Dental and vision insurance available after 90 days.

\\*\\*How to Apply: \\*\\*Please submit your resume and cover letter to be considered for the role.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $200,000.00 - $350,000.00 per year

title: MRI Technician
description:
**Job Title :** MRI Tech  
**Shift :** Weekend/Evenings (Monday/Friday - 3p-11p. Saturday/Sunday - 7:30a-7:30p)  
**Employment :** Travel - Onsite

**Duties**

* Position patient on examining table and place specified coil (receiver) such as head coil or knee coil close to area of interest, following protocols requested by Radiologist
* Demonstrate the use of microphones that allow patients and technologists to communicate during examination
* Enter data such as patient history, anatomical area to be scanned, orientation specified, and position of entry into aperture of MRI equipment into computer
* Key commands to specify scan sequences and adjust transmitters and receivers into computers
* Observe patient through window of control room and on closed circuit TV to monitor safety and comfort
* View images of areas being scanned on video display screen to ensure quality of pictures
* Key in data on keyboard of camera to photograph images
* Alert staff entering magnet room to the danger of wearing or carrying metal around magnet
* Other duties as assigned.

**Requirement**

* 1-3 years’ experience as MRI Technician
* Graduate of Accredited Radiology Program
* NJ State RT License
* MR Certified
* BLS Certification
* Critical thinking skills, decisive judgement and ability to work with minimal supervision
* Excellent communication skills
* Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including Word and Excel
* Ability to read and interpret documents
* Ability to work independently

**Main Skills Required**

* Siemens experience/knowledge. Currently running the following machines

Siemens Magnetom Sola 1.5T software platform XA51  
Siemens Magnetom Vida 3T software platform XA5

* IV certified and experienced
* Self-driven/motivated technologist
* Available nights and weekends

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55.80 - $65.40 per hour

Work Location: In person

You'll be working for a company that's fun and flexible. Not to mention, it's work experience you're going to use for a long time to come. You've had our pizza delivered to you, now help us be the best in pizza delivery. Go on, boss, show us what you've got. Apply now!

**JOB REQUIREMENTS AND DUTIES**


You are responsible for everything that happens during your shift. This includes all cost controls, inventory control, cash control and Customer relations. You must set the example. You must follow ALL policy and procedures 100% of the time and expect the same from your crew.


In addition: Staffing, Paperwork, Cost Controls, Cash control, Food management, Work to a Schedule, Perfect Image and adherence to standards, Great Customer Service, Attendance & punctuality, Transportation to/from work, Store cleanliness, Marketing, Profitability.

**ADVANCEMENT**


Many of our team members began their careers as delivery drivers and today are successful Domino's franchise owners. From assistant manager to general manager, general manager to franchisee or Manager Corporate Operations, our stores offer a world of opportunity.

**DIVERSITY**


Our mission is to recognize, appreciate, value and utilize the unique talents and contributions of all individuals. To create an environment where all team members, because of their differences, can reach their highest potential.

**SUMMARY STATEMENT**


We take pride in our team members and our team members take pride in Domino's Pizza! Being the best pizza delivery company in the world requires exceptional team members working together. At Domino's Pizza, our people come first!

**General Job Duties For All Store Team Members**

* Operate all equipment.
* Stock ingredients from delivery area to storage, work area, walk-in cooler.
* Prepare product.
* Receive and process telephone orders.
* Take inventory and complete associated paperwork.
* Clean equipment and facility approximately daily.

**Training**


Orientation and training provided on the job.

**Communication Skills**

* Ability to comprehend and give correct written instructions.
* Ability to communicate verbally with customers and co-workers to process orders both over the phone and in person.

**Essential Functions/Skills**

* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide accurately and quickly (may use calculator).
* Must be able to make correct monetary change.
* Verbal, writing, and telephone skills to take and process orders. Motor coordination between eyes and hands/fingers to rapidly and accurately make precise movements with speed.
* Ability to enter orders using a computer keyboard or touch screen.
* Navigational skills to read a map, locate addresses within designated delivery area.
* Must navigate adverse terrain including multi-story buildings, private homes, and other delivery sites while carrying product.

**Work Conditions**

**EXPOSURE TO**

* Varying and sometimes adverse weather conditions when removing trash and performing other outside tasks.
* In-store temperatures range from 36 degrees in cooler to 90 degrees and above in some work areas.
* Sudden changes in temperature in work area and while outside.
* Fumes from food odors.
* Exposure to cornmeal dust.
* Cramped quarters including walk-in cooler.
* Hot surfaces/tools from oven up to 500 degrees or higher.
* Sharp edges and moving mechanical parts.
* Varying and sometimes adverse weather conditions when delivering product, driving and couponing.

**SENSING**

* Talking and hearing on telephone. Near and mid-range vision for most in-store tasks.
* Depth perception.
* Ability to differentiate between hot and cold surfaces.
* Far vision and night vision for driving.

**TEMPERAMENTS**


The ability to direct activities, perform repetitive tasks, work alone and with others, work under stress, meet strict quality control standards, deal with people, analyze and compile data, make judgements and decisions.

 **Additional Information**  

  

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**, including, but not limited to the following:**Standing**


Most tasks are performed from a standing position. Walking surfaces include ceramic tile "bricks" with linoleum in some food process areas. Height of work surfaces is between 36" and 48".

**Walking**


For short distances for short durations


Delivery personnel must travel between the store and delivery vehicle and from the delivery vehicle to the customer's location.

**Sitting**


Paperwork is normally completed in an office at a desk or table

**Lifting**


Bulk product deliveries are made twice a week or more and are unloaded by the team member using a hand truck.


Deliveries may include cases of ingredients and supplies weighing up to 50 pounds with dimensions of up to 3' x 1.5'.


Cases are usually lifted from floor and stacked onto shelves up to 72" high.

**Carrying**


Large cans, weighing 3 pounds, 7 ounces, are carried from the workstation to storage shelves.


Occasionally, pizza sauce weighing 30 pounds is carried from the storage room to the front of the store.


Trays of pizza dough are carried three at a time over short distances, and weigh approximately 12 pounds per tray.


During delivery, carry pizzas and beverages while performing "walking" and "climbing" duties.

**Pushing**


To move trays which are placed on dollies.


A stack of trays on a dolly is approximately 24" - 30" and requires a force of up to 7.5 pounds to push.


Trays may also be pulled.

**Climbing**


Team members must infrequently navigate stairs or climb a ladder to change prices on signs, wash walls, perform maintenance.


During delivery of product, navigation of five or more flights of stairs may be required.**Stooping/Bending**


Forward bending at the waist is necessary at the pizza assembly station.


Toe room is present, but workers are unable to flex their knees while standing at this station.


Duration of this position is approximately 30 - 45 seconds at one time, repeated continuously during the day.


Forward bending is also present at the front counter and when stocking ingredients.

**Crouching/Squatting**


Performed occasionally to stock shelves and to clean low areas.

**Reaching**


Reaching is performed continuously; up, down and forward.


Workers reach above 72" occasionally to turn on/off oven controls, change prices on sign, and lift and lower objects to and from shelves.


Workers reaching down to perform such tasks as scooping cornmeal from a plastic barrel, or washing dishes.


Workers reach forward when obtaining topping ingredients, cleaning work surfaces, or answering phones.

**Driving**


Deliver pizzas within a designated delivery area. A Team Member may make several deliveries per shift.

**Machines, Tools, Equipment, Work Aids**


Team Members may be required to utilize pencils/pens, computers, telephones, calculators, TDD equipment, pizza cutter and pizza peel.

**Driving Specific Job Duties**


Deliver product by car and then to door of customer.


Deliver flyers and door hangers.

**Requires**


Valid driver's license with safe driving record meeting company standards.


Access to insured vehicle which can be used for delivery.
company_description: Founded as a single store in 1960, DPZ is the largest pizza company in the world. From the beginning, Domino’s has been dedicated to the best of service, quality products, and delivery.

title: Treatment Coordinator
description:
We believe that everyone deserves a perfect smile.

**We are looking for a passionate, outgoing, energized, customer focused and confident Treatment Coordinator that has sales experience. Spanish Speaking.** 

We will train you to engage our patients, discuss their treatment options and get them started on a journey to a new smile. We want our patients to feel confident in their smiles and as our TC, you help with the first step…saying yes to treatment. The right person will be well spoken, computer literate and an excellent communicator. Organizational skills are a must.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Treatment Coordinator contributes by passionately executing the company’s business model; promoting the company culture, mission and values. The Treatment Coordinator is responsible for creating a relationship with the patients that visit our practice and conducts the patient consultations where you provide patients with treatment options and review financial agreements.

Please be advised that this does not include all aspects of this position such as potential duties assigned by supervisors and requirements for flexibility.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILTIES

Practice Support

* Consistently performs specific assigned daily and general duties; meets deadlines
* Meets established attendance criteria and starts work promptly
* Knows and consistently implements the organizational missions and all approved policies, protocols and procedures
* Regularly supports compliance and accreditation effort as assigned including, but not limited to OSHA and HIPPA
* Respects and acknowledges the organization commitment to cultural diversity, which is expressed through behavior, language and actions
* Consistently demonstrates good use of time and resources
* Consistently interacts with the patients and staff in manner that reflects favorably on the organization and promotes teamwork
* Responsible for providing a positive and professional orthodontic dental experience, welcomes and greets patients and visitors to the practice [preferably by name]
* Oversee patient relations & handle patients complaints, under indirect supervision
* Help explain company policy to patients

Patient Management

* Receives New Patient Phone Calls
* Answer and respond to phone calls with professionalism
* Check the daily schedule for accuracy in Wave Ortho & OrthoFi
* Provides quality patient service
* Provide patient Information about our facilities, services offered, and the process of the new patient experience
* Greets and welcomes all patients upon arrival with a warm, friendly smile and is the second point of contact during the new patient experience after they are checked in by the Patient Specialist
* Assists the new patients in filling out new patient documents when needed
* Confirms that all patient information has been gather accurately
* Review Patient’s chart and obtain any missing information that may be missing
* Confirms new patient start appointments and ensures to provide the patient with all the required information to start treatment
* Facilitate Patient consults using OrthoFi where you will discuss the following
* Treatment Options
* Verification of Insurance
* Fees and Payment Agreement
* Obtain signed contracts, Informed Consents and ISmile Policies
* Collect and Post Initial Down Payment
* Communicates with Records Tech the type of records patient needs to commence treatment
* MCO – State Patients requires X-Rays, Pan, Ceph, all Intra-Oral Photos, Scan and HLD Evaluation Form Filled out by the doctor
* FFS – Pan Only and Facial Pictures
* REC START – Full Records X-Rays Pan Ceph, Intra-Oral Photos, iTero Scan and Signed Informed Consent with initial down Payment
* INS Private - requires a Pre-D, X-Rays, Pan, Ceph, Photos, ADA Form Signed by Patient.
* Updates consult list daily
* Responsible for follow-up of pending and denied consults
* Uses communication tools AVA, Sesame Communications for follow up
* Confirms and Schedules ZocDoc appointments
* Creates and sends out Welcome, Referral, and Doctors letters
* Doctor Visit
* Send out End of Day Emails
* Over all maintenance and organization of the Consult Room and Waiting area

New Patient Intake

* Obtain New Patient Information using NP Phone Slips
* Enter patient information into Wave Ortho and OrthoFi
* Required Information
* Patients Name with correct spelling [No Nick Names in Wave Ortho]
* Address [entire address must be written on the 1st address line in Wave Ortho]
* Email [required for OrthoFi to provide patients with electronic NP Forms]
* Phone Number [Required for text message appointment confirmation]
* Chart ID – Member Insurance ID
* Model ID – Name of Insurance
* Medicaid ID – State Patients CIN Number Only
* Award ID – MCO Patient Status [Pending, Approved, Denied]
* Gender – Male/Female
* Date of Birth
* Social Security [Required to verify Insurance]
* Contact Info – RESP PARTY A [Must be an Adult over the age of 18, Parent or Guardian
* Primary Insurance [State INS/MCO Must have Medicaid ID to submit for ortho coverage]
* Treatment Info [provide Initial Exam Date, Set Recall Dates, Enter Treatment Start Date]
* General Dentist Info [Required, if none must be referred to a new DDS]
* Referrer [Require, we want to know where the patient heard of us]

Minimum Education and Experience

High School Diploma or G.E.D

Excellent Customer Service Skills

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour plus bonuses

title: Laboratory Technician - Multiple Departments!
description:
**Company Description** *We are SGS – the world's leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for sustainability, quality and integrity. Our 99,600 employees operate a network of* ***2,6******0******0 offices and laboratories****, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.*

 **Job Description**  

Our **Dayton, NJ laboratory** is looking for a **Laboratory Technician** to join their team! The Laboratory Technician will prepare samples with accuracy and precision in accordance to SGS' analytical SOPs. The Laboratory Technician works independently and as part of a team to meet daily production targets and ensure hold times and turnaround times are met. The Laboratory Technician ensures best quality through adherence to all policies, procedures, and quality verifications. The Laboratory Technician always follows safe laboratory practices and maintains a safe working environment.  

  

**Job Functions**

* After appropriate training, independently prepare samples for analysis according to SGS’ SOPs, using basic instrumentation specific to the department and analytical methodologies.
* Performs routine operation, maintenance, calibration of preparation instruments/equipment.
* May assist with validation and MDL studies.
* Inputs and maintains technical information, as needed, to support the laboratory functions/operations.
* May conduct non-interpretive sample analysis and draft analytical reports.
* Maintains Laboratory Notebook where applicable.
* Adheres to internal standards, policies, and procedures.
* Performs all required quality verifications, ensuring best quality.
* Monitors inventory levels of chemicals and consumables, ensuring appropriate levels, at all times.
* Ensures all chemicals are labelled appropriately, required personal protective equipment is worn consistently, and all safety precautions are followed.
* Performs other duties as required.

  

**Qualifications**  

* High school diploma or equivalent and prior general working experience (Required)
* Associates Degree in a Chemistry or similar scientific discipline and 1-2 years of relevant laboratory experience (Preferred)
* Proficient English language skills (Required)
* Basic mathematical and reasoning skills (Required)
* Basic computer skills (Required)
* Ability to lift/carry/push or pull upwards of 25 lbs on a frequent basis (Required)

  

**Additional Information** *SGS is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such we recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristics protected by law.*  

  

*To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodations. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.*  

  

*This job description should not be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements, but a general description of the job. Nothing contained herein restricts the company’s rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.*

You will receive a callback. title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) - Clinic Based
description:
Success On The Spectrum is a national Autism Treatment franchise with a dedication to quality. We offer ABA, ST, OT, and Social Skills Classes in our nautical centers, in-home, and in-school. Our play-based model emphasizes on NET, so we take clients on field trips once per month! We also encourage high parent involvement and allow parents to watch their child’s therapy live from our viewing room!

We are opening a Brand New Location in Bridgewater, NJ . We are looking for an organized, clinically experienced BCBA who is seeking full-time employment. Our BCBAs must have good communication skills and a salesman-like enthusiasm, as you will be the main point of contact for parents.

We value work/life balance. Each BCBA is assisted by an intern and has a max caseload of 35 hours. Each location has a Clinical Director that is available to cover your caseload when you take vacation!

You will be responsible for training your team of behavior technicians and directly supervising them with clients. We can’t emphasize enough how vital your abilities of attention to detail are in this role, as you must adhere to the pre-authorized service schedule and properly document every service provided.

SOS is proud to have full billing transparency. Office Managers are responsible for making the daily client schedules. Nothing gets billed to insurance without BCBA approval.

Success On The Spectrum is growing quickly, and we can accelerate your career faster than any other company you will ever work for. There is a lot of opportunity for you to move up to Clinical Director at newly opening locations. Being part of a franchise also gives you the option of transferring to a different location, in the event that you need to move away. If you ever want to retire from clinical work, you will have the unique opportunity to open your own franchise!

SOS does not require employees to sign non-compete agreements. All BCBAs get two weeks of initial training from our corporate office - for this, you may have to travel to Houston for 1 week. We do not require training payback agreements.

Working for SOS: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BrXKM3XtjTY&t=25s

Our Mission: https://youtu.be/85rG7zcp7yM

Take a tour: https://youtu.be/KW-an-x9JWw

Learn more here:https://successonthespectrum.com/careers/

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Seeking Experienced Registered Nurse for Clinical Trial Patient Home Visits**

Hawthorne Health, Inc. has an exciting opportunity for experienced **Registered Nurse** to join our growing **HERO** community and network of clinicians who bring the clinical trial assessment to patients anytime, anywhere.

**About Hawthorne Heroes:**

Our goal at Hawthorne Health is to make clinical trials accessible and convenient for everyone. To accomplish this, Hawthorne Effect’s solution marries technology and design with a distributed workforce to deliver clinical trials to patients anytime, anywhere. Our magic is the unique combination of a software platform and specialty service network called Heroes to support the completion of follow-up visits with 100% of data points captured. Our heart is the **Hawthorne Effect Research Outcomes (HERO, Heroes) network, a community of healthcare professionals across all specialties and therapeutic areas including but not limited to Registered Nurses, PA/NP, Physicians, Sonographers and Phlebotomists.** Heroes are invited through the platform to conduct visits to create amazing experiences for patients and trusted support to research teams. For Heroes, it is an opportunity to enhance healthcare career portfolios through a highly specialized workforce economy. For patients, it is about convenience with a personal touch by bringing the follow up visit directly to them.

**The role of the Hero Registered Nurse role and responsibilities:**

* Complete up to seven in home visits per patient that require timed blood draw collections
* Local and regional visits may require some travel (within identified region)
* Patient education and engagement

**The visit assessments consists of:**

* Excellent phlebotomy skills

**Requirements:**

* PBT-ASCP
* Valid state driver's license, car registration/insurance, and reliable vehicle
* Pass a background check
* Willingness to travel
* Availability to visit patients on a short notice

**LINK:** https://hawthornehealth.com/become-a-hawthorne-hero/

title: Science and ELA Middle School Teaching Positions
description:
About Us

Amani Public Charter School is a stand-alone middle school for grades 5-8, located in Mount Vernon, NY. Our mission is to provide Mount Vernon students with the academic skills necessary to succeed in competitive high school programs, college, and their chosen careers. Since opening in 2010, Amani has offered the Mount Vernon community the option of School Choice.

What We Offer

* Competitive salaries commensurate with experience
* Comprehensive benefits package
* Extensive professional development
* Laptop computer, email, and up-to-date classroom technologies for all staff members

About the Role

We are seeking dedicated teachers who are committed to promoting independent, critical thinkers in various subject areas, including English Language Arts and 7th-8th grade Living Environment/Science. Our ideal candidates will exemplify techniques and traits aimed at closing the achievement gap and transforming at-risk students into achievers.

Key Responsibilities:

* Create engaging, rigorous, and differentiated lessons using provided curriculum
* Implement standards-aligned formative and summative assessments
* Analyze assessment data to inform and differentiate instructional practices
* Develop lesson plans for in-person and virtual implementation
* Maintain online classrooms via Google Classroom
* Participate in regular data meetings, administrative observations, and professional development
* Manage online student information systems (SchoolTool, Google Classroom, Kickboard)
* Implement consistent behavior management strategies
* Ensure students' mastery of academic standards
* Create a positive, structured learning environment
* Communicate effectively with students, families, and colleagues
* Support grade-level and school-wide activities throughout the year

Qualifications

* Bachelor's degree in Education or related subject area (required)
* Master's degree (preferred)
* NYS Teaching Certification (required for some positions, preferred for others)
* 2+ years teaching experience (preferred)
* Previous experience with middle school-aged children (preferred)
* Comfort with online learning and teaching
* Proficiency in Google Suite and Google Classroom

Subject-Specific RequirementsEnglish Language Arts:

* Dedication to promoting appreciation for the power of words
* Experience with various literature to encourage a love for reading and writing

Living Environment:

* Ability to plan and implement lab-based, critical thinking science lessons
* Familiarity with NYS Regents Living Environment curriculum
* Prepare students for the Living Environment Regents Exam in June

Amani believes in being a diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to building a talented team that reflects our students' backgrounds.

title: Bookkeeper and Office HR Manager at ABG Print
description:
**Bookkeeper and Office HR Manager at ABG Print**

**About ABG Print:**  
ABG Print (www.ABGPrint.com) is a fast-growing, 24/6 B2B printing and distribution company located in New York City. We specialize in high-quality, rapid-turnaround printing services for leading investment banks, financial institutions, and large corporations. Our services include printing, binding, and finishing multi-page documents such as presentations, booklets, magazines, catalogs, proposals, and reports. We have recently expanded our offerings to include large-format printing, including posters and banners for corporate events, trade shows, and conferences. We pride ourselves on delivering top-notch production, superior customer service, and maintaining strong information security practices.

We are looking to hire a qualified and experienced **Bookkeeper and Office HR Manager** to join our team.

**Key Responsibilities:Finance & Bookkeeping:**

* **Accounts Receivable:**
* Manage client setup and account maintenance in QuickBooks Online.
* Compile and send invoices to clients, process incoming payments (checks, ACH, credit cards), and ensure timely collection of receivables.
* **Accounts Payable:**
* Set up and manage vendor accounts, process purchase orders and incoming invoices, and handle vendor inquiries.
* Oversee employee credit card accounts and manage vendor 1099 disbursements.
* **Financial Reporting:**
* Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, including tax documents and year-end reconciliations.
* Perform monthly and annual closings in accounting software and maintain general ledger entries and Chart of Accounts.
* Reconcile petty cash fund monthly.
* Provide financial insights and recommendations to the President.
* Prepare and present quarterly executive financial summaries.
* Identify areas for potential expense reductions and cost savings (with an opportunity for additional compensation based on successful savings recommendations).

**HR and Office Administration:Human Resources:**

* Manage employee attendance records and PTO requests, forwarding semi-monthly time-off information to our external PEO provider.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date personnel files and manage the onboarding/offboarding process, including employee setup, documentation, policy review, and exit interviews.
* Collaborate with the President on HR functions, such as employee job descriptions, company policy, and manuals.
* Handle benefits administration, including annual enrollment notifications and liaising with our PEO for new hires. Assist employees with benefits questions.
* **Handle year-end 5500 reporting** to ensure compliance with employee benefit plan regulations.
* Provide payroll documentation and timekeeping reports to the President and manage non-salaried employee timesheets.
* Maintain and track business insurance policies, including renewals and certificate requests.

**Office Administration:**

* Oversee general office management, including handling mail distribution, managing office supplies, and ensuring the smooth operation of office facilities.
* Coordinate with vendors for non-production services (e.g., office cleaning, HVAC, etc.) and address any facility-related issues.
* Ensure that the office environment is well-maintained and supports productivity.

**Qualifications & Requirements:**

* **QuickBooks Proficiency (Online Version) is essential – seriously, you must be a pro!**
* **Advanced Microsoft Office 365 Skills** (Excel, Word, Teams, etc.).
* Experience with **third-party vendor portals**, such as Ariba, Bill.com, or similar payable management software.
* **Exceptional organizational, verbal, and written communication skills**.
* Self-driven, detail-oriented, and able to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to maintain high ethical standards, with sensitivity to the confidentiality of company and client information.
* **Problem-solving skills** with the ability to quickly adapt and learn new systems and processes.
* Strong interpersonal skills, confident and courteous demeanor, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization.
* **Desire for growth:** Interested in developing leadership skills and advancing within the company.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive base salary ranging from **$60,000 - $80,000**, with opportunities for year-end bonuses.
* Generous **PTO** plan, including paid holidays.
* **Health benefits** and **401K** plan.
* Career advancement opportunities within a fast-growing company.
* Equal Opportunity Employer: We encourage diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Psychotherapist: LCSW - LMFT - LPC
description:
**Now Hiring A Psychotherapist in Hoboken, NJ!**

Here at **Anchor Therapy**, we are an established mental health group private practice in downtown Hoboken, NJ. We are seeking a dedicated part-time or full-time psychotherapist that can contribute to our growing team. **We take care of everything so you can focus on your clients.**

At Anchor Therapy, we require evening and/or weekend hours. For part-time, there is a minimum of 15 mandatory clinical hours per week, while full-time will require a minimum of 25 clinical hours per week. We are an out-of-network practice with insurance **and have a steady stream of referrals.** The therapists at Anchor Therapy are given the opportunity to work in a supportive, fun, professional, positive, and familial work environment where employees feel appreciated and valued. We are a collaborative team that gets to work with some of the best clients that the Hoboken community has to offer. Experience with CBT clinical skills as well as children, teens, young adults, and/or couples is desired. At Anchor Therapy there is no need to worry about quarterly taxes, marketing expenses, or any other overhead costs because candidates will be **employee status**. We are the perfect place to make the switch from agency work to private practice. We make this a smooth experience for the potential candidate to learn from a supportive and experienced group owner.

**Compensation will be fee-for-service at the following rates and is paid out biweekly:**

* $100/ 60 minute intake session/ couples counseling or family session
* $70/ 45 minute individual therapy session
* *Provisionally Licensed Therapists (LAC, LSW ) will be paid out at a lower rate based on their experience.*

**We provide:**

* Full medical benefits (including dental and vision) for full-time employees
* 401K (with 3% employer automatic contribution)
* Steady stream of referrals
* Highly competitive pay and benefits
* Intake coordination, including screening and scheduling of new clients
* Individual consultation
* Biweekly group case consultation
* Weekly supervision for provisionally licensed therapists (LAC, LSW)
* Paid sick time
* Paid administrative time
* Other health benefits (disability, hospital, accident, cancer coverage, and life insurance)
* Team support
* Professional trainings
* Beautifully decorated and calming office suite in the best location in Hoboken (right across from the Hoboken Path train station, bus station, and NY ferry - with NYC views!)
* Unlimited coffee bar with snacks
* Electronic health records
* Marketing
* Billing services
* Growth opportunity
* Flexible scheduling, including ability to work remotely
* HIPAA-compliant professional e-mail
* Fun team outings

**Minimum Requirements are:**

* Current State of New Jersey license as a **LCSW, LPC, LMFT, LSW, LAC, PsyD, or PhD**
* Mandatory 15 clinical hours minimum per week
* Available to work nights and/or weekends
* 2 years of counseling experience

**Required education:**

* Master's or Doctorate

**Required license:**

* LCSW, LPC, LMFT, LSW, LAC, PsyD, or PhD

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**

* Anchor Therapy values a diverse workplace and strongly encourages and welcomes all people of color, LGBTQIA+ individuals, and members of ethnic minorities to apply.

**For consideration, applicants must:**

* Send resume and cover letter to Courtney Glashow (email can be found on Anchor Therapy website)
* Complete our employment questionnaire on our Anchor Therapy website: anchortherapy.org/careers-counseling-job-position

Applicants who complete the requirements and match our needs will be contacted for a phone screening before an in person interview.

title: Lower School Spanish Teacher
description:
SUMMARY OF POSITION:

Whitby seeks an experienced, innovative Spanish teacher to join our lower school team of passionate educators in grades 1-4. We strive to provide excellence in Spanish language acquisition, as well as literature and culture instruction to students with a range of experiences, abilities, and passions.

At Whitby, students are active participants who drive the learning process through inquiry and reflection. In order to help students engage to their fullest potential, the Spanish department employs a holistic approach, committed to helping all students discover not only the skills, concepts and broader ideas surrounding language and literature, but also who they are as learners and as people.

Whitby offers differentiated Spanish instruction to all students from our toddler classes to grade 8. Classes are flexibly grouped at each grade from 1-4. Classes focus on improving each student’s ability to comprehend and produce orally and through writing. Ideas presented in Spanish classes are rooted in a deep conceptual framework and placed within larger global contexts to help students make sense of the world around them. Students examine multiple genres and text types through reading and writing. Peer and self-assessment, teacher conferencing, and total immersion are key components of our program.

A willingness to collaborate with colleagues, a love of lower school, and a passion for Spanish language and Hispanic culture are a must.

REQUIREMENTS:

* Holds a Bachelor’s degree in elementary/secondary education, Spanish, or a related field
* Native or fully bilingual Spanish speaker
* Has a minimum of two+ years of experience teaching
* While not essential, IB PYP experience would be a plus
* Willingness to engage in IB PYP training and professional development
* Satisfactory completion of pre-employment background check

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Teaching

* Engages students in active learning
* Promotes a “hands-on and minds-on” culture of thinking, stimulates inquiry into local, regional and global issues from multiple perspectives and develops the understanding that the opinions of others may also be right.
* Challenges students to become life-long learners by taking risks and reflecting on their experiences
* Delivers differentiated instruction based on identified student needs and learning styles
* Utilizes a range of teaching techniques effectively and inquiry-based instruction whenever appropriate
* Engages collaboratively with members of the World Languages department and the school faculty
* Integrates a variety of resources effectively to enhance instruction
* Communicates in a clear, inviting, respectful, and caring manner with students
* Institutes effective classroom management routines; utilizes positive discipline techniques and displays awareness of the whole classroom
* Builds a strong sense of personal and social responsibility that sets the foundation for a balanced lifestyle and encourages service to others, our community and our environment.
* Promotes international-mindedness throughout our curriculum by exploring our diversity of culture, language and experience while gaining insights from the unique perspectives of our host culture.
* Develops the use of technology as a learning tool within the classroom and as an extension of the classroom when appropriate.

title: Calibration Technician
description:
Custom Calibration Solutions, LLC is a US based calibration firm with four US laboratories. We are seeking a talented individual to work in our main lab in Hamilton, NJ. The applicant would attend to ship-in calibration jobs in Hamilton in addition to onsite calibration events local to NJ. The main area of focus for this individual would be fiber optic calibration, but not limited to such.

**Responsibilities:**

-Perform calibration and testing on a diversity of equipment described below  
-Navigate to and from jobsites

-Interface between customers and Custom-Cal admin to reach desired outcomes

**Skills: On the job "over the shoulder" training will be provided, but the applicant should have at least a familiarity with all the below devices. You must have prior calibration experience. Resumes without prior metrology experience will not be considered. The following are organized in order of most importance to least importance. The stronger your metrology background the higher your compensation will be.** 

-Strong technical knowledge of fiber optic calibration/instrumentation including optical power meters, attenuators, wavelength meters, spectrum analyzers, extinction ratio meters, return loss meters, polarization scramblers/controllers, others

-Strong technical knowledge of high voltage and low voltage power testing equipment and calibration (hipot tester, AC electronic load, DC electronic load, power supplies, current shunts, LCR meter, static meter, Clamp-on meter, calibrator, digital multimeter, decade resistor, dataloggers, ohmmeter, voltmeter)

- Strong technical knowledge of thermal and physical dimension calibration (environmental chambers, humidity monitor, torque wrenches, torque screwdrivers, torque testers, thermocouple meter, scales, thermocouples, height gauge)

- Technical knowledge of microwave insturment calibration (oscilloscopes, frequency counter, pulse generator, waveform generator, probes)

Please note that this job description is not exhaustive and may be subject to change based on the needs of the company.
